intro: Psychotria nandarivatensis, commonly known as the Madagascar Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are clustered in cymes. Psychotria nandarivatensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical significance in traditional medicine.
